title: Embed Google Form on Registration page and keep /registration route live

requirements.summary: Embed the provided Google Form on the /registration page iframe area and make it usable on mobile/desktop.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/lib/registrationConfig.ts is updated so registrationConfig.googleFormEmbedUrl is set to use the provided form (https://forms.gle/HFbiXDq74sSw1tPg6) in a way that works in an iframe (i.e., the embedded form loads successfully on the page).
Visiting /registration shows the embedded form (not the placeholder state).
The embedded form is usable (scrollable if needed) on both mobile and desktop viewports.

file_operations.description: Set registrationConfig.googleFormEmbedUrl to the user-provided Google Form link (https://forms.gle/HFbiXDq74sSw1tPg6) using an iframe-compatible embed form (e.g., ensure the configured URL is an embeddable Google Forms URL or includes the needed embedded rendering parameters).

Update the embedded iframe rendering to reliably load the configured embed URL and improve usability across viewports (responsive sizing/min-height and scroll behavior as needed) while keeping the embed inside the existing iframe area. Use existing shadcn-ui components already on the page (Button, Card) as-is for layout consistency; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Keep /registration registered in the SPA router and ensure static SPA fallbacks exist for direct loads/refresh without 404.
acceptanceCriteria: The TanStack Router route for /registration remains registered in frontend/src/App.tsx.
Directly loading /registration in the deployed site (including browser refresh) serves the SPA and renders the Registration page content.
The existing SPA fallback entrypoints for /registration (frontend/public/registration.html and frontend/public/registration/index.html) continue to be present and correctly mount the app.

file_operations.description: Verify /registration remains a stable TanStack Router route (registered in the route tree with path exactly '/registration') and keep it wired to RegistrationPage so in-app navigation renders correctly.

Ensure the /registration SPA fallback HTML continues to correctly mount the React app (root mount element present and main module script included) so direct navigation/refresh does not 404 in production.

Ensure the /registration/index.html SPA fallback HTML continues to correctly mount the React app (root mount element present and main module script included) to support deployments that serve index.html for nested paths.
